blocks.name: df-dmqss
blocks.content: Define the class of domain quotients. Domain quotients are pairs of sets, typically a relation and a set, where the quotient (see ~ df-qs ) of the relation on its domain is equal to the set. See comments of ~ df-ers for the motivation for this definition. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 16-Apr-2019.)

blocks.name: df-dmqs
blocks.content: Define the domain quotient predicate. (Read: the domain quotient of ` R ` is ` A ` .) If ` A ` and ` R ` are sets, the domain quotient binary relation and the domain quotient predicate are the same, see ~ brdmqssqs . (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 9-Aug-2021.)

blocks.name: dmqseq
blocks.content: Equality theorem for domain quotient. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 17-Apr-2019.)

blocks.name: dmqseqi

blocks.name: dmqseqd

blocks.name: dmqseqeq1
blocks.content: Equality theorem for domain quotient. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 17-Apr-2019.)

blocks.content: Equality theorem for domain quotient, inference version. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 26-Sep-2021.)

blocks.name: dmqseqeq1d
blocks.content: Equality theorem for domain quotient set, deduction version. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 26-Sep-2021.)

blocks.name: brdmqss
blocks.content: The domain quotient binary relation. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 17-Apr-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm brdmqss(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wb(wbr(c2, cdmqss, c0), wceq(cqs(cdm(c2), c2), c0)))
} = {
  ancoms(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wb(wbr(c2, cdmqss, c0), wceq(cqs(cdm(c2), c2), c0)))
  brabga(hs0, hs1, c2, c3, c0, c1, cdmqss, wceq(cqs(cdm(c2), c2), c0), wceq(cqs(cdm(cv(hs0)), cv(hs0)), cv(hs1)))
  eqeqan12d(cqs(cdm(cv(hs0)), cv(hs0)), cv(hs1), cqs(cdm(c2), c2), c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cv(hs1), c0))
  dmqseq(cv(hs0), c2)
  id(wceq(cv(hs1), c0))
  df-dmqss(hs0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cqs(cdm(c2), c2), c0))
  diff.hs1.w(wceq(cqs(cdm(c2), c2), c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm brdmqss(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈ c3)→(c2[DomainQss]c0 ↔(dom(c2)/. c2)= c0))
} = {
  ancoms(c0 ∈ c1, c2 ∈ c3, (c2[DomainQss]c0 ↔(dom(c2)/. c2)= c0))
  brabga(hs0, hs1, c2, c3, c0, c1, cdmqss, (dom(c2)/. c2)= c0, (dom(hs0)/. hs0)= hs1)
  eqeqan12d((dom(hs0)/. hs0), hs1, (dom(c2)/. c2), c0, hs0 = c2, hs1 = c0)
  dmqseq(hs0, c2)
  id(hs1 = c0)
  df-dmqss(hs0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w((dom(c2)/. c2)= c0)
  diff.hs1.w((dom(c2)/. c2)= c0)
}

blocks.name: brdmqssqs
blocks.content: If ` A ` and ` R ` are sets, the domain quotient binary relation and the domain quotient predicate are the same. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 14-Aug-2021.)

blocks.name: n0eldmqs
blocks.content: The empty set is not an element of a domain quotient. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 2-Mar-2018.)

blocks.name: n0eldmqseq
blocks.content: The empty set is not an element of a domain quotient. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 3-Nov-2018.)

blocks.name: n0el3
blocks.content: Two ways of expressing that the empty set is not an element of a class. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 27-May-2021.)

blocks.name: cnvepresdmqss
blocks.content: The domain quotient binary relation of the restricted converse epsilon relation is equivalent to the negated elementhood of the empty set in the restriction. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 14-Aug-2021.)

blocks.name: cnvepresdmqs
blocks.content: The domain quotient predicate for the restricted converse epsilon relation is equivalent to the negated elementhood of the empty set in the restriction. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 14-Aug-2021.)

blocks.name: unidmqs
blocks.content: The range of a relation is equal to the union of the domain quotient. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 13-Oct-2018.)

blocks.name: unidmqseq
blocks.content: The union of the domain quotient of a relation is equal to the class ` A ` if and only if the range is equal to it as well. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 21-Apr-2019.) (Revised by Peter Mazsa, 28-Dec-2021.)

blocks.name: dmqseqim
blocks.content: If the domain quotient of a relation is equal to the class ` A ` , then the range of the relation is the union of the class. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 29-Dec-2021.)

blocks.name: dmqseqim2
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ erim2 . (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 29-Dec-2021.)

blocks.name: releldmqs
blocks.content: Elementhood in the domain quotient of a relation. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 24-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm releldmqs(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wrel(c2), wb(wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(c2), c2)), wrex(s0, cdm(c2), wrex(s1, cec(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s0), c2)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  ex(wcel(c0, c1), wrel(c2), wb(wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(c2), c2)), wrex(s0, cdm(c2), wrex(s1, cec(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s0), c2))))))
  bitr3d(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wrel(c2)), wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(c2), c2)), wrex(s0, cdm(c2), wrex(s1, cec(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s0), c2)))), wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(cres(c2, cdm(c2))), cres(c2, cdm(c2)))))
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wrel(c2), wb(wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(cres(c2, cdm(c2))), cres(c2, cdm(c2)))), wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(c2), c2))))
  eleq2d(c0, cqs(cdm(cres(c2, cdm(c2))), cres(c2, cdm(c2))), cqs(cdm(c2), c2), wrel(c2))
  dmqseqd(cres(c2, cdm(c2)), c2, wrel(c2))
  resdm(c2)
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wrel(c2), wb(wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(cres(c2, cdm(c2))), cres(c2, cdm(c2)))), wrex(s0, cdm(c2), wrex(s1, cec(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s0), c2))))))
  eldmqsres2(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, cdm(c2))
  diff.cdm.s(s0, c2)
  diff.cdm.s(s1, c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm releldmqs(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →(Rel(c2)→(c0 ∈(dom(c2)/. c2)↔ ∃(s0 ∈ dom(c2), ∃(s1 ∈[s0]c2, c0 =[s0]c2)))))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
} = {
  ex(c0 ∈ c1, Rel(c2), (c0 ∈(dom(c2)/. c2)↔ ∃(s0 ∈ dom(c2), ∃(s1 ∈[s0]c2, c0 =[s0]c2))))
  bitr3d((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ Rel(c2)), c0 ∈(dom(c2)/. c2), ∃(s0 ∈ dom(c2), ∃(s1 ∈[s0]c2, c0 =[s0]c2)), c0 ∈(dom((c2 |` dom(c2)))/.(c2 |` dom(c2))))
  adantl(c0 ∈ c1, Rel(c2), (c0 ∈(dom((c2 |` dom(c2)))/.(c2 |` dom(c2)))↔ c0 ∈(dom(c2)/. c2)))
  eleq2d(c0, (dom((c2 |` dom(c2)))/.(c2 |` dom(c2))), (dom(c2)/. c2), Rel(c2))
  dmqseqd((c2 |` dom(c2)), c2, Rel(c2))
  resdm(c2)
  adantr(c0 ∈ c1, Rel(c2), (c0 ∈(dom((c2 |` dom(c2)))/.(c2 |` dom(c2)))↔ ∃(s0 ∈ dom(c2), ∃(s1 ∈[s0]c2, c0 =[s0]c2))))
  eldmqsres2(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, dom(c2))
  diff.cdm.s(s0, c2)
  diff.cdm.s(s1, c2)
}

blocks.name: eldmqs1cossres
blocks.content: Elementhood in the domain quotient of the class of cosets by a restriction. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 4-May-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm eldmqs1cossres(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(ccoss(cres(c2, c3))), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))), wrex(s0, c3, wrex(s1, cec(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  syl6bbr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(ccoss(cres(c2, c3))), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))), wrex(s0, c3, wrex(s1, cec(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))))), wex(s1, wa(wrex(s0, c3, wcel(cv(s1), cec(cv(s0), c2))), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))))))
  syl6bb(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(ccoss(cres(c2, c3))), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))), wex(s1, wa(wrex(s0, c3, wcel(cv(s1), cec(cv(s0), c2))), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))))), wrex(s1, cdm(ccoss(cres(c2, c3))), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3))))))
  elqsg(s1, c0, c1, cdm(ccoss(cres(c2, c3))), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))
  bitri(wrex(s1, cdm(ccoss(cres(c2, c3))), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3))))), wex(s1, wa(wrex(s0, c3, wcel(cv(s1), cec(cv(s0), c2))), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))))), wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cdm(ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))))))
  df-rex(s1, cdm(ccoss(cres(c2, c3))), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))))
  exbii(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cdm(ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3))))), wa(wrex(s0, c3, wcel(cv(s1), cec(cv(s0), c2))), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3))))))
  anbi1i(wcel(cv(s1), cdm(ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))), wrex(s0, c3, wcel(cv(s1), cec(cv(s0), c2))))
  elv(s1, wb(wcel(cv(s1), cdm(ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))), wrex(s0, c3, wcel(cv(s1), cec(cv(s0), c2)))))
  eldm1cossres2(s0, cv(s1), universe, c2, c3)
  bitri(wrex(s0, c3, wrex(s1, cec(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))))), wex(s1, wa(wrex(s0, c3, wcel(cv(s1), cec(cv(s0), c2))), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))))), wrex(s0, c3, wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cec(cv(s0), c2)), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3))))))))
  rexbii(s0, c3, wrex(s1, cec(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3))))), wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cec(cv(s0), c2)), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))))))
  df-rex(s1, cec(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))))
  bitri(wrex(s0, c3, wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cec(cv(s0), c2)), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3))))))), wex(s1, wa(wrex(s0, c3, wcel(cv(s1), cec(cv(s0), c2))), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))))), wex(s1, wrex(s0, c3, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cec(cv(s0), c2)), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3))))))))
  rexcom4(s0, s1, c3, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cec(cv(s0), c2)), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3))))))
  exbii(s1, wrex(s0, c3, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cec(cv(s0), c2)), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))))), wa(wrex(s0, c3, wcel(cv(s1), cec(cv(s0), c2))), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3))))))
  r19.41v(s0, c3, wcel(cv(s1), cec(cv(s0), c2)), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))))
  diff.cdm.s(s1, ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))
  diff.ccoss.s(s1, cres(c2, c3))
  diff.cres.s(s1, c2, c3)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3))))
  diff.cec.s(s0, cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, c3)))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.ccoss.s(s0, cres(c2, c3))
  diff.cres.s(s0, c2, c3)
}

blocks.name: releldmqscoss
blocks.content: Elementhood in the domain quotient of the class of cosets by a relation. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 23-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm releldmqscoss(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wrel(c2), wb(wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(ccoss(c2)), ccoss(c2))), wrex(s0, cdm(c2), wrex(s1, cec(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(c2))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  ex(wcel(c0, c1), wrel(c2), wb(wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(ccoss(c2)), ccoss(c2))), wrex(s0, cdm(c2), wrex(s1, cec(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(c2)))))))
  3bitr3d(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wrel(c2)), wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(ccoss(c2)), ccoss(c2))), wrex(s0, cdm(c2), wrex(s1, cec(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(c2))))), wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(ccoss(cres(c2, cdm(c2)))), ccoss(cres(c2, cdm(c2))))), wrex(s0, cdm(c2), wrex(s1, cec(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, cdm(c2))))))))
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wrel(c2), wb(wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(ccoss(cres(c2, cdm(c2)))), ccoss(cres(c2, cdm(c2))))), wrex(s0, cdm(c2), wrex(s1, cec(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, cdm(c2)))))))))
  eldmqs1cossres(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, cdm(c2))
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wrel(c2), wb(wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(ccoss(cres(c2, cdm(c2)))), ccoss(cres(c2, cdm(c2))))), wcel(c0, cqs(cdm(ccoss(c2)), ccoss(c2)))))
  eleq2d(c0, cqs(cdm(ccoss(cres(c2, cdm(c2)))), ccoss(cres(c2, cdm(c2)))), cqs(cdm(ccoss(c2)), ccoss(c2)), wrel(c2))
  dmqseqd(ccoss(cres(c2, cdm(c2))), ccoss(c2), wrel(c2))
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wrel(c2), wb(wrex(s0, cdm(c2), wrex(s1, cec(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, cdm(c2))))))), wrex(s0, cdm(c2), wrex(s1, cec(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(c2)))))))
  2rexbidv(s0, s1, cdm(c2), cec(cv(s0), c2), wrel(c2), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, cdm(c2))))), wceq(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(c2))))
  eqeq2d(c0, cec(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, cdm(c2)))), cec(cv(s1), ccoss(c2)), wrel(c2))
  eceq2d(cv(s1), ccoss(cres(c2, cdm(c2))), ccoss(c2), wrel(c2))
  cosseqd(cres(c2, cdm(c2)), c2, wrel(c2))
  resdm(c2)
  diff.cdm.s(s0, c2)
  diff.cdm.s(s1, c2)
  diff.wrel.s(s0, c2)
  diff.wrel.s(s1, c2)
}

blocks.name: dmqscoelseq
blocks.content: Two ways to express the equality of the domain quotient of the coelements on the class ` A ` with the class ` A ` . (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 26-Sep-2021.)

blocks.name: dmqs1cosscnvepreseq
blocks.content: Two ways to express the equality of the domain quotient of the coelements on the class ` A ` with the class ` A ` . (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 26-Sep-2021.)
